metadata.title: CVE-2021-25802 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability in the AVI_ExtractSubtitle component ofVideoLAN VLC Media Player 3.0.11 allows attackers to cause an out-of-boundsread via a crafted .avi file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-25802` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc-bin - 3.0.18-2build3
libvlc5 - 3.0.18-2build3
libvlccore9 - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc-bin - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc-data - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc-l10n - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.18-2build3
vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.18-2build3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vlc package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.18-2build3').
